dataIdInfo.idAbs: The NH Department of Environmental Services (NHDES) has developed geographic information on the boundaries of shellfish growing waters in NH’s tidal waters. Under the authority granted by RSA 143:21, RSA 143:21-a and RSA 487:34, NHDES uses a set of guidelines and standards known as the National Shellfish Sanitation Program (NSSP) for classifying shellfish growing waters. The purpose of this coverage is to compile all relevant information about the classification of shellfish growing areas in NH’s tidal waters.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of this coverage is to compile all relevant information about the classification of shellfish growing areas in NH’s tidal waters for calendar year 2019. This shapefile depicts classifications that were legally in effect on January 1, 2019.

Consts.useLimit: The Department of Environmental Services (NHDES) makes these data and information available to enhance public knowledge and promote education. The data provided should not be used for navigational purposes and are not intended to identify the official mean high tide line demarcating the public trust boundary. NHDES cannot guarantee accuracy and reliability of these data. NHDES also retains the right to make changes to the data made available without prior notice. Neither NHDES nor any of its employees, contractors, or subcontractors, make any warranty, express or implied, nor assume any legal liability or responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness of any data, nor represent that its use would not infringe on privately owned rights. The data are provided with the understanding that they are not guaranteed to be usable, timely, accurate, or complete. NHDES assumes no liability, any damages or loss of any kind that might arise from the use of, misuse of, or the inability to use these data. NHDES assumes no liability for any damages or loss of any kind caused by any errors or omissions in the data. All data are distributed “as is,” without warranties of any kind, either express or implied, and subject to the terms and conditions stated in this disclaimer.

attr.attrdef: The perimeter of the polygon in feet.
The current shellfish harvest classification of the polygon.
The state that the polygon is in. “ME” is an abbreviation for Maine. “NH” is an abbreviation for New Hampshire.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: If the polygon is a tributary to Hampton/Seabrook Harbor, then the field will say “Y” for Yes. If not, the field will be blank.

If the polygon is part of a prohibited/safety zone, then the field will say “Vessel” for a Vessel Prohibited Area or “WWTF” for a Waste Water Treatment Facility Prohibited Area. If the field is blank, then the polygon is not a prohibited/safety zone.

This field qualifies polygons into five categories: "OPEN", “OPEN (Sat.)”, "CLOSED", "NEWCLOSURE" and "MAINE". If a growing area has the potential to be open for harvest, then it is labeled "OPEN". If a growing area is open only on Saturdays from 9am-sunset, then it is labeled “OPEN (Sat.). If a growing area does not have the potential to be open for harvest, then it is labeled "CLOSED". If a growing area is one that is subject to a seasonal closure from October to the following April (due to concerns with viral contamination from the Portsmouth NH wastewater treatment facility), then it is labeled as "NEWCLOSURE." If a growing area is in Maine, then it is labeled "MAINE".

The growing area to which the polygon is associated, as related to the sanitary survey. “AC” is an abbreviation for the Atlantic Coast. “BLM” is an abbreviation for the Bellamy River. “GB” is an abbreviation for Great Bay. “HH” is an abbreviation for Hampton/Seabrook Harbor. “LH” is an abbreviation for Little Harbor/Back Channel. “LLB” is an abbreviation for Lower Little Bay. “LMP” is an abbreviation for the Lamprey River. “LPR” is an abbreviation for the Lower Piscataqua River. “OYS” is an abbreviation for the Oyster River. “PRN” is an abbreviation for Piscataqua River North, which includes the Upper Piscataqua River and the tidal portions of the Cocheco and Salmon Falls rivers. “RH” is an abbreviation for Rye Harbor. “SQM” is an abbreviation for the Squamscott River. “ULB” is an abbreviation for Upper Little Bay. “WIN” is an abbreviation for the Winnicut River.
The area of the polygon in square feet.
The name of the polygon classified by NHDES.
The area of the polygon in acres.

The growing area to which the polygon is associated, as illustrated in the New Hampshire Coastal Atlas. “AP is an abbreviation for the Adams Point area. "ACN" is an abbreviation for the Atlantic Coast Nearshore. "ACO" is an abbreviation for the Atlantic Coast Offshore. "BLM" is an abbreviation for the Bellamy River. “DP” is an abbreviation for the Durham Point area. "GB" is an abbreviation for Great Bay. "HH" is an abbreviation for Hampton/Seabrook Harbor. “LBDP” is an abbreviation for the Litte Bay Dover Point area. "LH" is an abbreviation for Little Harbor/Back Channel. "LLB" is an abbreviation for Lower Little Bay. "LMP" is an abbreviation for the Lamprey River. "LPR" is an abbreviation for the Lower Piscataqua River. "OYS" is an abbreviation for the Oyster River. "PRN" is an abbreviation for Piscataqua River North, which includes the Upper Piscataqua River and the tidal portions of the Cocheco and Salmon Falls rivers. "RH" is an abbreviation for Rye Harbor. "SQM" is an abbreviation for the Squamscott River. "ULB" is an abbreviation for Upper Little Bay. "WIN" is an abbreviation for the Winnicut River.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Text description of the geographic areas in the NH Coastal Atlas.
